title: Platinum 3 from 10 games (Fresh account)
body:
So I was curious about the highest rank you could get from a new unranked all seasons account.
I had seen Youtubers and streamers get Gold 1 and Plat 5-4 and assumed this was the highest possible placement for an account which had never held any previous rank.
After going 10/10 in my placements on a fresh account I can now conclude that it is possible to get Platinum 3 on 10 wins 0 losses.
Sorry it's a little unclear ign is "Ball Sac Noodle" and this was achieved a few weeks ago.
Interested to hear if anyone else has gotten this or higher on a new account.
Cheers.

replies.body: Obvious winning is the big contributor, I just meant do you need like a ratio of cs per minute aswell k/d being a factor into the rank you're placed. Overall things a team would get points for in an LCS game or something.

I think it's based on mmr, so it takes your previous mmr, and then uses the mmr system for placements. If you lost 5 games in a row then won 5 games you would get placed lower than if you had the losses dispersed. So on a fresh account, it is entirely dependant upon placements and you can get Plat 1 if you play at a scaled high elo level, everything below that is trying it's best to be accurate to a close elo to last season. (Mostly under)
If it is a fresh account it is a bit unpredictable and some people have placed at elos really high or low compared to what they are on a main.
Can you tell me what determines your placement? Amount of cs, k/d??

If it's a new account that hasn't been placed then wins, i.e. 7/3 Gold4+ 10/0 plat+ think 4/6 is silver 4-3 and so on
If it is an existing account with a previous rank you're essentially trying to regain that previous rank you had by going 10/0
As far as I can tell kd/cs/S+ makes no difference there's really only 2 major factors:
Wins
Previous rank

> If it's a new account that hasn't been placed then wins, i.e. 7/3 Gold4+ 10/0 plat+ think 4/6 is silver 4-3 and so on
> If it is an existing account with a previous rank you're essentially trying to regain that previous rank you had by going 10/0
> As far as I can tell kd/cs/S+ makes no difference there's really only 2 major factors:
> Wins
> Previous rank

It also factors in the elo of your team and the enemies team.

This is most likely correct (since nobody really knows). If they base it on your K/D and CS the system would be so easy to abuse and you could just anti-social split push your way to a high placement. 

Wins is definitely a big thing for placements, and usually the system wants to get you settled into the right kind of niche early on so you don't have such a big impact on games (goes both ways, for both bad players and smurfs).

People usually notice the biggest changes in matchmaking after their first 3ish games, where if they win all three on a fresh account they start versing mid goldish pretty quickly.
Where you place from all 10 games takes into consideration the MMR of your teams and opponents, and sometimes you hit luck of the draw and are able to get placed in slightly higher MMR games that you keep winning so the system keeps moving you up. You could also be unlucky and still keep winning your games but be placed into more average MMR games (especially with all of those youtubers and streamers that do these challenges, often do it at peak times with a larger population so they aren't forced upward).
This is so bs. Even if I win all 10 of my games on a new account it throws me into gold 1 where all the reject plats are.
Yeah, I understand the new account thing. Thanks for clearing that up for me.
